body_html:
MlWoo brought up the conv3d issue because we received formal request from HPC researchers who are using super computers (mostly CPU only) in high energy physics domain. These researchers are currently using TF but they have a strong wish to shift to pytorch as they claimed dynamic graph is more easy to construct their model. We helped them deploy pytorch on super computer environment and did some optimization. Conv3d is one of their hot features, so Mlwoo did the optimization.

log or exp can be properly vectorized by using svml with gcc, -mveclibabi=svml, icc does the vectorization by default.

body:
MlWoo brought up the conv3d issue because we received formal request from HPC researchers who are using super computers (mostly CPU only) in [high energy physics domain](http://www.nersc.gov/users/data-analytics/data-analytics-2/deep-learning/). These researchers are currently using TF but they have a strong wish to shift to pytorch as they claimed dynamic graph is more easy to construct their model. We helped them deploy pytorch on super computer environment and did some optimization. Conv3d is one of their hot features, so Mlwoo did the optimization.

`log` or `exp` can be properly vectorized by using svml with gcc, -mveclibabi=svml, icc does the vectorization by default.
